qas.question: What court was established under the aegis of the United Nations to prosecute genocidal crimes in Rwanda?
The prosecutorial efforts of the ICTR focused on genocidal acts that took place during which time period?
the ICTR was created in November 1995 by which branch of the UN?

answers.text: the Security Council of the United Nations

qas.question: The ICTR was established for the purpose of convicting those responsible for acts of genocide and what other charges?

answers.text: serious violations of the international law

qas.question: The charges of genocide brought up by the ICTR were against what group of people?
What court was established to prosecute genocidal crimes in the United Nations?
During which time period did the prosecuratorial efforts of Rwanda focus on genocidal acts?

plausible_answers.text: the Security Council of the United Nations

qas.question: Which branch of the UN created Rwanda in November 1995?

plausible_answers.text: serious violations of the international law

qas.question: What other charges besides genocide was the ITCR convicted of?
What group of people were the charges of genocide brought up against in April 1994?

context: The <a0_0><b5_0>International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda<b5_0/> (ICTR)<a0_0/> is a court under the auspices of the United Nations for the prosecution of offenses committed in Rwanda during the genocide which occurred there during <a1_0><b6_0>April 1994<b6_0/><a1_0/>, commencing on 6 April. The ICTR was created on 8 November 1994 by <a2_0><b7_0>the Security Council of the United Nations<b7_0/><a2_0/> in order to judge those people responsible for the acts of genocide and other <a3_0><b8_0>serious violations of the international law<b8_0/><a3_0/> performed in the territory of Rwanda, or by <a4_0><b9_0>Rwandan citizens<b9_0/><a4_0/> in nearby states, between 1 January and 31 December 1994.
